title: Volume of a solid with known cross-section

content.prompt: Let R be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of y = ln ( 3 − x ) , for 0 ≤ x ≤ 2 . R is the base of a solid for which each cross section perpendicular to the x-axis is a square. What is the volume of the solid?

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
